name: Drum Castle

geography.description: A large castle atop the highest peak of Drum Island, serving as the royal palace of the Drum Kingdom. Features a top dome and various interior chambers.

keyEvents.description: Final battle between Luffy and Wapol takes place inside and atop the castle
keyEvents.significance: Location of the climactic confrontation that ends Wapol's tyrannical rule

keyEvents.description: Wapol unveils the Royal Drum Crown Seven-Shot Bliking Cannon at the top dome
keyEvents.significance: Shows the castle's defensive capabilities, though they prove ineffective

keyEvents.description: Dr. Hiriluk's flag is displayed on a spire and defended by Luffy
keyEvents.significance: The flag becomes a symbol of the kingdom's transformation from tyranny to hope

keyEvents.description: Wapol is defeated and sent flying from the castle, marking the end of the Drum Kingdom
keyEvents.significance: The castle transitions from a symbol of oppression to one of liberation

culturalSignificance: The castle represents the seat of power for Drum Island. Under Wapol it was a symbol of tyranny, but after his defeat it becomes a symbol of the kingdom's rebirth as Sakura Kingdom.

name: Drum Ropeway

geography.description: A gondola cable car system that transports people from the base of the mountain to Drum Castle at the peak. Allows access to the castle for those unable to climb the mountain.

keyEvents.description: Dalton, Zoro, Usopp, and Vivi arrive at Drum Castle via the ropeway gondola
keyEvents.significance: Provides transportation for witnesses to Wapol's defeat and the kingdom's liberation

keyEvents.description: During the ride, Dalton recalls Wapol's tyrannical history
keyEvents.significance: The journey becomes a moment of reflection on the kingdom's oppression

culturalSignificance: The ropeway represents accessibility to power and government. It allows the common people and injured soldiers like Dalton to reach the castle and witness the change in leadership.

name: Drum Island

geography.description: A winter island characterized by tall, drum-shaped mountains and perpetual snowfall. Home to the Drum Kingdom, which becomes Sakura Kingdom after Wapol's defeat.

keyEvents.description: Wapol is sent flying from Drum Island by Luffy's attack
keyEvents.significance: Physically removes the tyrant from the island, symbolizing complete liberation

keyEvents.description: The end of the Drum Kingdom is declared, setting the stage for the island's rebirth
keyEvents.significance: Marks a major historical transition for the island and its people

culturalSignificance: Drum Island transforms from a kingdom ruled by a tyrant who hoarded doctors to a liberated land that will embrace Dr. Hiriluk's ideals of healing and hope.
